Name        : eucalyptus                   Relocations: (not relocatable)
Version     : 4.1.0                             Vendor: Eucalyptus Systems, Inc.
Release     : 0.0.23023.353.20150116git0f5f4f1.el6   Build Date: Fri 16 Jan 2015 06:20:52 PM PST
Install Date: Sat 17 Jan 2015 01:23:22 AM PST      Build Host: ip-172-16-20-98

comments.body: seen this issue with latest packages using shared ceph cluster as blockstorage as well
tried on a single cluster w/ EMC cloud, failed as well
I have both the clouds, please let me know if anyone wants to take a look

[~shaon], can you bump up the log level to DEBUG on the NC and attach the logs? 

[~dmitrii], looks like the volume libvirt xml creation on NC might be using an incorrect parameter. Unfortunately this might be throwing a wrench in EBS backed instance migration for all storage backends. I'm debugging the NC code right now but let me know if you can get to it sooner

Debugged the issue to [line 1246 of handlers_default.c|https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/blob/6adee6d55a78362976330efc5fd186c4f21cb24c/node/handlers_default.c#L1246]. Destination NC fails to lookup the instance in its collection of instances during the first attempt of migration. As a result, path to the instance directory is never returned to routine that creates the libvirt xml for the volume. The path being used in the above logs seems to be crud in the char array thats never initialized. Interestingly, the instance migration to the same destination works on the later attempts.

[~dmitrii], have you had a chance to look at this one yet? 

[~tjcramer], are we planning on targeting this for 4.1.0? FYI, the issue breaks EBS backed instance store migration irrespective of storage backend.
Assigning the bug to [~dmitrii] for further debugging the issue.

Thanks for the thorough investigation, [~swathi]!

I think I know what's happening. As part of EBS refactoring, we added {{(create | read | delete)_vol_xml}} functions, which are used both by dynamically attached volumes (via {{doAttachVolume()}} handler) and by volumes attached at run time (via {{create_instance_backing() > art_implement_tree() > creator()}}). Both of these functions were designed to accept {{instanceId}} (rather than a pointer to an {{ncInstance}} structure) because in one of the two cases ({{create_instance_backing}}) instance structure is not available. Thus, a low-level function ({{get_instance_path}}) has to look up an instance just to get its instance path. The problem we're hitting here is that when an incoming migrating instance is being set up, {{create_vol_xml()}} is called before the instance structure is added to the global set of instances (in {{doMigrateInstances()}}, which happens regardless of whether migration is successful or not, which explains why secondary attempts to migrate success while the primary one does not).

At Cornell we are seeing this issue with SC with Dell Equallogic SAN as well. We have not been able to migrate any EBS backed instances since upgrading to Eucalyptus 4.1. Let me know if you need more logs to analyze the problem. I'd happy to provide them.
Simple test to verify: migrate an instance with EBS volumes attached. Should verify with both root-EBS and non-root EBS vols. Merged into maint-4.1 and master.

The setup is simple 1 frontend (CLC/CC/SC/UFS/Walrus) , the SC backend is DAS. The NC's are on a private network as this is most commonly seen in field setups.

Thanks for the analysis [~dshekhawat]. I am seeing the similar issue.

I have a fix for this. The issue is a state transition and timing with a monitoring thread that tries to clean up the migration on the destination node while it is still in progress. I am testing the fix for regressions and should have it in the maintenance branch tomorrow.
Pushed the follow-up fix to maint-4.1 branch. Confirmed manually and with [~tony] and [~mmunn1] that HVM and EBS instances migrate properly.
